comment: Dr. Gao is a great professor. Her lectures are interesting and inviting, and her classwork is easy to understand. She is very opinionated and teaches her beliefs as fact, but it's (usually) in a good way. She's pretty chill with students and easy to distract during class (again, in a good way). I thoroughly enjoyed this class.
Paper, 2 tests, 6 DPs. Dr. Gao is great! She is prompt with emails and is an entertaining lecturer. Tests are a little on the hard side, but doable if you study and take notes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Gao is a nice lady, but this class is way more confusing than it needs to be. Her powerpoints often have little to do with the readings and the wording of the test questions is confusing. Discussion posts and interview paper take a lot of time to write, but are not difficult. This class could have been less of a headache if organized better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gao is amazing! She is so encouraging and a great teacher and is so smart. 10 out of 10 would recommend taking her for public speaking. She is incredible.

Prof. Gao is brilliant, but is not a good teacher. She always gets off topic and doesn't seem to think actually teaching the class content is important. She flies through ppts but thinks students are actually learning something from her random lectures. She is an easy grader and gives extra credit, but does take off points for random things.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Seems knowledgeable but has a hard time connecting with students. Tries to be funny. Small class size. Cares for students. Easy to talk to outside of class and offers extra credit. Graded by speechs, paper work for the speeches, and tests. Whats on the test is not what she talks about, use the text book to study for test. Common sense Qs.

Took Professor Gao's Public Speaking communications course. She is funny and gives extra credit opportunities. However, she is a tough grader on presentations and tests and especially the final exam which is all very difficult because it does not relate to the content of her notes. She didn't really use the guidebook much.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Gao was definitely an interesting teacher. Shes funny, but wasnt my favorite. Her grading is very lenient but also takes off points for dumb things. For example, she took off 3 points for saying Japanese people in a subtitle instead of Japanese immigrants. Class was easy aside from the midterm & Final. Her study guide is a list of terms.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Tests? Not many--Tests are tough

comment: Dr. Gao is great but I have mixed feelings about the assignments. The midterm was tough, but the final was easy. The paper/interview project was very time-consuming, but not hard to write, nor did she grade it harshly. Extra credit is unlimited but only worth 5 pts each on a 1000-pt scale. The material was interesting and Dr. Gao is very funny.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Good class her lectures can be a little boring. She's really funny. Not that many grades so you need to focus and do well on them to do well in the class.

Dr. Gao is a nice lady and a good professor.  She is very laid back and down to earth.  Her test are confusing so you will need the book to accompany any in class notes you may take and her Power Points.  She gives you plenty of opportunities for extra credit.  She really does want you to pass her class.

Gao is amazing at making your think outside of the box, learned a lot about other cultures and she was funny and awesome. Gives you a lot of chances to get extra credit if you need it. YOU NEED THE BOOK because her power points lack info and the tests questions are super confusing. Made all A's and B's with little to no effort.

I really enjoyed her class! I learned many new things about communicated with other cultures and different types of people. The course gave me different outlook on the world of communication. I would definitely recommend her for this course!

Dr. Gao is an excellent professor. I had fun learning in her class. There are discussion posts, 2 exams and a research paper. The paper is not that difficult, you are able to choose from the topics she gives or make up your own. However, the exams are quite difficult but she gives several extra credit opportunities.

Will make you read her own work, but it's not completely boring. She does assign two papers and two tests (midterm/final). The papers have to be long, but she clearly lays out what she wants on each page. The tests are multiple choice but she gives you a list of terms to study. She sends out an attendance sheet each class. 5 easy online posts.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Gao is a really caring professor who really wants you to pass. For this class, there are two exams, an interview project, two papers, and online discussion. She gives a lot of chances for extra credit. She takes attendance every class and it is part of your grade. She is pretty laid back, and I would take her again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had Dr. Gao for Intercultural Communications. The class consisted of 2 tests, 1 huge paper, and 5 discussion posts. Just do the work and go to class (participation200pts) and you will do fine! Her class is great because she incorporates the material into real life stories from her own experiences. She is very nice and will make you laugh.

Dr. Gao has been one of my favorite professors! She is tough, but more than willing to help. There are two papers, two tests that are pretty hard, and weekly online discussions. She gives tons of extra credit and is very encouraging. I would definitely take her for another course.

Dr. Gao is a nice lady, but her class is tough. She does not teach in class but attendance is mandatory. There are only 2 tests and 1 big paper that you work on throughout the semester. Be prepared for the exams to be tough and for you to teach yourself the material. Extra credit will save your life in this class!

Dr. Goa is  intelligent and personable. However, I often found that the lectures lingered. But if you come to class and keep up with the work, you'll most likely pass. Plus, she offers extra credit. Her test are kind of wordy and difficult so  having strong comprehension skills and using the process of elimination will be helpful.

Dr. Gao is nice, but her class is tough. There are two exams, two papers, and online homework. Her exams are hard to ace, but she is an easy grader when it comes to written assignments/papers. She also gives tons of extra credit opportunities. If you read the book and go to class, it's not hard to make a B.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Extra credit is always offered. She is definitely willing to help her students out, and talk about anything. Gets a little off topic sometimes, but overall an interesting class. Definitely would take her again.

expect to learn the material yourself. Only a midterm and a final. Big research paper but that isn't too bad, just don't procrastinate.  she doesn't teach anything in class but every class you miss, you loose 10 points off your final grade.

Overall, Dr. Gao is a great professor! I took her for Intercultural Com and it was a very interesting class. You'll learn a lot about other cultures. Get ready to read, but it's worth it! PLEASE study for the two exams, if you do, then you'll be fine. Also, come to class!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very well informed professor. Knowledgeable of course content and provides valuable insight into intercultural communication. Provides extra credit opportunities. Wants students to succeed in her course.
The class only consist of a few grades so be mindful. Don't procrastinate. Take advantage of the extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A midterm, a final, 5 discussion board posts, and a 15 page research paper. The tests are worded in an odd way which makes doing well on them hard regardless how well you know the information, but DB posts and paper are graded favorably. Definitely take her for this class. Lots of extra credit opportunities and you'll walk away a better person.

In this class you really don't need the book. We had 5 online discussion posts, 1 lit review, a midterm, a final and a final paper. The final paper was 15 pages but that includes your lit review. She tends to get off topic a lot and you might feel like class is a waste of time. Come to class, do the online work, study and you'll be fine.

I took her as a hybrid. Her tests weren't easy, but on everything else I felt she was an easy grader. She gives so many opportunities for extra credit. If you want to make an A in this class you can, it just depends on how much work you want to put into it. She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed! Fun class to go to!

Professor Gao is a very sweet professor, but almost everyone in our class failed the midterm. The tests were extremely difficult, and we often get off topic in class. Luckily though, she gives a ton of extra credit!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Her tests are very difficult and do not make much sense. Pretty much everyone failed the midterm. She offers so much extra credit that you should be fine. Very passionate about the class. Attendance is mandatory and the lectures are extremely boring. She gets way off topic and does not even finish the power points. Did other class homework.
Prof Gao is cool. Her class is easy if you read and participate in class discussions. She relates everything back to you, so it makes it a little more interesting. Plus, she gives a ton of EC.
Dr. Gao really cares about the subject she is teaching. The assignments aren't difficult but feel redundant. Gives tons of extra credit opportunities!

Assigns a lot of reading from the textbook as well as supplemental journal articles she posts online. Attendance is taken every class and is a large part of your grade. She gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit. There is no homework, easy discussion assignments and two papers and two test (midterm/final) that are pretty difficult.

Assigns a lot of reading from the textbook as well as supplemental journal articles she posts online. Attendance is taken every class and is a huge part of your grade. Gives lots of opportunities for extra credit. No homework, easy discussion assignments and 2 papers and 2 large tests that are pretty difficult.
Fun class, not too difficult. Learned a lot about culture.

Lectures are long and often off topic but she is knowledgeable of the material and is willing to help you out anyway she can for almost any reason. Test are decent and the papers are spread out and graded in pieces to make one giant paper.
Great teacher, super funny, two tests, and research paper, such a sweet lady
Class sort of drags out. Attendance is mandatory.
Great teacher but English is her second language.
Only 2 test and 1 paper

Professor Gao makes class really fun. She is great at applying the content of what we are learning in class to real life situations. Sometimes class gets stuck on one random subject and then you don't really do anything in class. Other than that, it was a great class!

Professor Gao is very enthusiastic and knows what she is talking about! Come to every class, the attendance will add up. Assignments not difficult at all, ask her for any help. Gives ALOT of extra credit opportunities so take advantage.
Gao is super sweet and easy to talk to. She is also a pretty easy grader and gives study guides.
Dr. GAO is a awesome professor! Grades fair and cover material clearly!

She's so animated, you can really tell that she loves teaching her classes. She always makes sure you know the information. The only problem would be that she doesn't give a lot of feedback. I would definitely take her again!

She is a very straight forward professor. She can come off as blunt or rude sometimes but you can tell she means well and wants her students to learn and do well. She gives tons of valuable info. related to COMM and everyday life. I would take her again. Read the chapters 2 tests, 1 two part paper and discussion post grades honestly so work for it.
Dr. Gao is a great professor. Long papers, but the class is very interesting.
Lectures did not seem to have much to do with the test.  One midterm.  A large paper broken into 2 parts.  A little hard to understand but gives tons of extra credit!
She's a good professor.  There are no test just a midterm and a final. She gives a lot of extra credit. I would take her again.

I love Dr. Gao's class. She is really passionate about the different cultures. She loves people to participate in this class. We only had two papers, online posts, midterm exam and final. I would really recommend.

I really enjoyed the class and Dr. Gao is an interesting professor with very credible experience.  Only had two tests, a Midterm and Final that were a little difficult, but she offers so much extra credit I could have flunked both and still managed a B.  Don't think about -not- getting the textbook, you'll need it.

Tests where easy if you read the book. She doesn't discuss it much because it was a hybrid but she uses a ton of personal examples of intercultural communication. I can tell she's passionate about it, but she is really hard to reach so make sure to ask your question in or after class. LOVES EXTRA CREDIT! She gives a ton! I tokok her hybrid course.
2 Test 2 Papers, 2nd paper required interviews

I really liked her class it made me want to learn as much as I could about other cultures. She offers loads of extra credit as well. The test can be a little difficult  so read the chapters from the text book and go over her study guide. The paper you have to do also forces you outside your comfort zone though you learn a lot by doing it.

This professor is passionate about the material and knows what she is talking about. Class discussions are a bit common sense and don't prepare you for the tests, but attendance is mandatory. Two papers and two tests make up the semester. Overall, fairly easy class

She's a great professor. Whenever she gives the study for midterm and final, make sure you read it but you also have to read the book. There are questions that were not covered in the study guide. She gives a lot of extra credit, make sure to take advantage of it as it will help later on. She definitely knows her material and she's interesting.

In order to pass you have to read and go above for the tests and not only trust the study guide she gives you because there are also questions that dont come from the study guide that end up on the test.

Dr. Gao is really cool and really funny - she's very passionate about what she teaches on.  There are times throughout the semester where guidelines and the general direction of the class is unclear but the material is interesting nevertheless.

This class was a hybrid course being taught half online and half in the classroom. It was a self-taught course as Dr. Gao expected much reading and learning to be done outside the class to prepare for the lectures. This class is one that you can easily do well in, but you have to put in the time and effort as there are few grades. Good Course.
Literally 2 tests and a paper.  The class is not hard, just do the work. I barely even used my book honestly.

Okay, so she's not a bad teacher at all. The only problem is that she's not very clear on guidelines and when she was grading it showed. However, she is an interesting professor. If you're into Asian Studies TAKE HER!
Test are hard. Discussions are interesting but may not be too beneficial to you on the tests. She's very passionate about the course.
She is very encouraging. The way she teaches is very enjoyable. Gives online posting assignments. Gives long papers  with clear explanations on what and how to write them.
Grades fairly. Classes are fun and interactive. Test are a little difficult, but if you use the study guide to study, you should do fine. Gives TONS of extra credit

Professor Gao provides extra credit opportunities, if you do the extra credit you will find that if is fun and entertaining it inspires you to become intercultural. Most of the extra credit is on campus, I enjoyed doing the extra credit assignments.

Complete the extra credit! It can really help if you didn't score as high on the mid-term or final as you might have liked to. I feel that this course give students a great opportunity to learn about the importance of intercultural communication. After taking this course, students are better equipted to interact with individuals of other cultures.
Dr. Gao is a great professor. She is easy to communicate with and responds to emails in a timely manner. The class is interesting and easy if you pay attention. Taker her!

Learned a good bit in this class but it wasn't easy. the two tests are hard and she is a tough grader on the essay.  she does give lots of extra credit! And you can only miss two classes.  Overall, good experience.
The class itself honestly isn't hard at all, theres 2 tests and a paper. She gives a lot of extra credit work, and by alot I mean ALOT!
Dr. Gao, is a great professor!! She keeps the class interesting and is very knowledgable about the material. I was able to learn many new things about intercultural communication.

The class is not difficult; however, I took this class as a hybrid. The lectures were discussion based so everything on the test had to be learned on our own time. There is plenty of extra credit opportunities. Attendance is mandatory yet I felt that students did not benefit anything from being in class.
Dr. Gao is solid.  She's super fun.  The class can, at times, lack direction and seem like its going nowhere - but when this is the case, it's still interesting and fun.  Not a hard course.

The class is not difficult; however, I took this class as a hybrid. The lectures were discussion based so everything on the test had to be learned on our own time. There is plenty of extra credit opportunities.  Attendance is mandatory yet I felt that students did not benefit anything from being in class.
Most of the semester is spent working on final research paper 9-12 pages long. Tests are difficult
The best teacher ever. Very understanding, explains things to you when you don't understand it and is very approachable.

she enthusiastic about the material. Class dicsussions are very common. Encourages students to share. However, class discussions do NOT help you on the test. Study on your own time. And maybe read the book.

Dr. Gao is really funny, she takes the time to get to know her students and helps them a lot with intercultural communication. She will encourage you to participate in a lot of extra credit opportunities, take them. Not only are they fun but really helpful to your college, personal, and professional development. Ask questions and she will clarify.

I was engaged and learned a lot in her class. I never took a Maymester, but I'm really glad that I took it for credit. Dr. Gao held the classes attention and presented all information very well. She's very interactive. She gives you everything she expects of you in the beginning so no surprises and has multiple opportunities for extra credit.
Dr. Gao was very helpful to help the class become more knowledgeable about Intercultural Communication. She kept the class interested and she was engaging. Definitely take her class.
she's awesome. love her accent!
Dr. Gao was a great instructor, providing opportunities to learn about the culture and communication.

I really enjoyed Dr. Gao's course. She really keeps the student engaged and she teaches the course well. For a paymaster class, Im glad this was my first experience. She is also hilarious. I would definitely take another course with her.

She was helpful. When you ask questions she is there to answer and elaborate. Very funny and laid back but professional as well. Work is easy just need to actually do it. Test are okay but if you study more than one day you will pass.
Fun teacher! I enjoyed going to classes, which were really informative!

She is so passionate about Intercultural communication, making it a very interesting topic to learn about. The tests are somewhat difficult, but she allows a lot of extra credit to make up for a bad grade. She has definitely been one of my favorite teachers and I wish I could have her again. Having good class participation makes the class great!

I took this course during maymester. Dr. Gao is a wonderful professor. You will learn a lot from this course. Make sure you show up and do the work assigned, that's all she asks. In COM3325 course you will learn how how to conduct yourself around other cultures. I would take her again.

I really enjoyed Dr. Gao's class, even thought it was a Maymaster. She makes the course very interesting and has a lot of knowledge to share with the class from her experiences. I wish she taught other communication classes so I could take her again! Definitely one of my favorite professors. Take her class! You will leave knowledgeable & inspired.

I absolutely love Dr. Gao! She was so hilarious. I learned so much from this course and would definitely take it again. Dr. Gao is a professor that wants you to succeed and really cares about her students. As long as you are doing your part this class will be easy-breezy. Definitely read both the book and the power points. Tests are not that easy.

I am taking Dr. Gao for Maymester Intercultural Comm. She is one of the all around best professors I have had at KSU. She is intelligent, helpful, and wants you to succeed. Be prepared to read, but this is college so that's normal. She gives several opportunities for extra credit. She encourages class discussions so we leave better rounded people.

She is a really good teacher and i like hearing about her experience in her field. I wish the whole class was like that because she has so many stories that relate to class. If you thoroughly look over the study guides you will pass the tests.

I think Professor Gao was a great teacher! Her class is interesting to say the least and I feel like she would be your best choice. She gives so many opportunities for extra credit so there's no way you won't at least get a B in the class. Tests aren't too bad if you study.
She is a very tough grader but she gives more extra credit than she does graded assignments.  She is very nice and speaks well but the material is easier than she makes it.
Professor offers numerous opportunities for extra credit.

She was a very fair grader and gave 10 separate extra credit opportunities ( which bumps you at least a letter grade. Class was interesting and you feel like you learned something. Would definitely take again.

Dr. Gao is very knowledgeable about many different cultures but, you won't discuss much, if any, of the material during class. She will review the study guide,  a list of terms, before each test (midterm and final) but the test aren't hard if you know the terms on the study guide. There is 1 big project that will consist of 2 papers

Dr. Gao is very knowledgeable in Intercultural Communication because she has real-world experience. She is very pleasant to her students and respects differences that may come up. She is very instrumental in her students' success. You have to show initiative and she will be more than happy to help you succeed and learn.  Read and participate!

Professor May is a great teacher hands down. Class time is easy and quick, a few online postings which are as easy as 1,2,3... Her main course paper is long, but not time consuming and she gives multiple options for paper topics. She even gives you the outline for the paper, making it easy as pie to get done!
There is nothing hard about this class exept you have to learn the material on your own. Prof. Gao barely goes over the material in class, but the tests are 100% based on textbook and her powerpoint.

She knows what she is talking about but has a difficult time explaining it. It was a hybrid class which made all the difference- I never would have been able to do this all in a lecture class. Going to class only matters for attendance points, otherwise there isn't much to learn. Everything is out of the book or on the online assignments.

2 Tests, midterm and final. One major paper that is split into 2 papers during the semester. This paper is what the whole class revolves around. 5 Discussions which she doesn't grade until the end. Lots of extra credit opportunities. She's okay, not my favorite. Takes attendance too.

Dr. Gao is hilarious and will keep you interested during lectures. She shows lots of video clips and has a ton of class discussions. Tests are hard and straight from the book-you MUST study. Discussion posts every week, one big (easy) paper, and 2 tests. She gives TONS of extra credit opportunities which makes up for the difficulty of the tests!

She is very passionate about the content and class material.  Even though she is passionate, her lectures tend to stray away from content.  Her tests are very difficult. 2 papers, one is a term paper.  She has some good stories but I would not take this class again.

Very well organized professor that is clear to understand and helpful. She will make you work for your grade, but she is an excellent professor that will make you a better writer and more engaged student.
She's great for extra credit and her assignments are explained in detail. You have to come to class and it's mostly lecture too. Tests are difficult

Really sweet, very informative.  Passionate and knowledgable.  Tends to wander during lecture and class isn't as structure as I personally think it should be, but great teacher overall and a good class to take.
She's a good teacher and I would take it again.

A very interesting class! Professor Gao was great! Really makes lectures engaging and facilitates good discussion with class. Tests were a little tough. Easy online discussions and a paper that was split throughout the semester. If you come to class and participate, you will do fine.

Dr. Gao gives plenty of time for all assignments. Two big papers but the second builds off the first and she makes it easy. Timely feedback. Go to class because attendance is a big part of your grade. Make sure to do all discussion posts & responses because you'll print them off and turn in at the end. Nice professor, I would definitely take again
Classtime is somewhat irrelevant. Tests are straight from the book. Majority of your grade is on papers and discussion posts which she doesn't really cover at all in class. But she takes attendance.

Great professor! We did a lot of in class group discussions and went over power points almost every week. Attendance is important, she offers multiple extra credit opportunities to help you throughout the course.
Has an accent, but makes up for it with clear presentations and syllabus.
Good class, if you do the reading and study you will be fine but the tests are HARD
Great class!
Her tests are tough and her papers are quite lengthy, but she offers a lot of simple extra credit. She is a sweet person and a decent professor.
She only has a midterm and final as test grades and they are difficult. However if you show up to class and do the online assignments that is a good portion of you're grade

Overall good as long as you kept up with the readings and assignments. She has 5 disc posts that are spread out 5 weeks out of the course.  A midterm and final. A research paper that is 9-10 pages but is split up throughout the semester. Lectures are long, she will go until very end of class. Going to class-big part of grade. Lots of extra credit
Great Professor.  Wants everyone to study aboard.  Very helpful and passionate about intercultural communications.
She is a great professor and is very personable! She has done research and is currently doing research in the field  so the information in the class is current and relevant.

Dr. Gao is a very helpful teacher and she is passionate about what she teaches. She does a great job with engaging the class and uses group activities in each class for everyone to be able to participate in the discussions. There are two essays, a midterm and a final. Dr. Gao is so helpful! TAKE HER!
Love her!
Two big papers and two big tests. Attendance is a major part of your grade but she is helpful and wants students to do well. Plenty of extra credit opportunities.
great teacher!

Dr. Gao wants her students to consider other peoples' points of view and to look at things objectively before taking a position. She encourages free discussions and treats people with sincerity and kindness. Something other professors should learn.
She does a good job at engaging the class, and truly wants her students to succeed. She gives a decent amout of extra-credit too.
I feel that she is passionate about her courses and interacts well with her students. If you do the work and make an effort she will do what she can to help you.

Professor Gao was extremely helpful and considerate to her students. I took this class as a Maymester and she was very understanding with the amount of work and reading we needed to do in such a short span of time. She wants you to do well and gives plenty of opportunities to gain points. Very interesting class as well!
Professor was really cool! make sure you show up and do the work.

I took this class as May master, I loved it. Dr Gao is very knowledgeable. Yes, she talks about China and that is great because it gave us a lot information on culture, business, and so. Opportunity to extra work was available.

She is very helpful if you ask for help. She brought in guest speakers and is very enthusiastic about her work. Make sure your Lit. Review coincides with the instructions. Maymester-make sure to keep up with reading and notes

Dr. Gao's class has been surprisingly fun. She responds very well to questions and is available to clarify material. This class is challenging, but if you do your work and study the vocabulary in the chapters, you will do fine on the test. The questions can be tricky, but this is to be expected seeing as this is an upper level class!

LOVED this professor. TAKE HER!! She is sooo helpful & wants you to get an A as much as you do! She's so sweet & understanding & offers extra credit! I was hesitant to take her due to the reviews I read on here but I needed the class and hers was the only one left available. It honestly couldn't have worked out better. Seriously, easy A.

I took this class over Maymester. Since the content was spread over ten days there was a lot of work, but nothing that time management doesn't fix. Dr. Gao is a wonderful professor who definitely knows her material. I would highly recommend her, especially for Maymester.
Challenging, but knows the subject well. Don't take the class as a maymester. There's too much information to cram into two weeks.

I took this class as a maymester course. I thought Dr. Gao was a good professor to teach this course. She kept it interesting for the most part, even though the course was not that interesting to me to begin with. She shares many stories about her experiences in China, which relate to the material of the course.
I really enjoyed this class! I loved her incorporation of real-life examples and current problems going on throughout the world.
Really good teacher. Very passionate about the subject and helpful. Very interesting lectures and learned a lot.
She makes this class interesting.
She's the most fun teacher I've taken at KSU, she makes it easy to understand the subject. I would take her again in a heart beat!
Very good teacher. Grades fair but the tests are a little tricky.
I can honestly say that Dr Gao is one of the best professor at KSU. Dr. Gao's insight and her carefully,thought out explanations made a complex subject easy to understand. Thank you
Worst teacher ever!!! She does not teach. She does not clarify anything. Class is a waist of your time!!! All she talks about is China, China, China. If you take her be prepared to teach yourself!!!

I took Prof Gao for intercultural comm as a hybrid. I thought it was pretty easy. I'm not the best student (didn't really read the textbook/ powerpoints unless a test was coming up) and made a B. The actual classes were kind of pointless, but at least were interesting. It was a midterm, final, and research paper. Do the work/ study and you'll be ok

One of the worst teachers I have ever had. She was rude, offensive, very unhelpful, did not reply to emails.. When I talked to her after class, she did not listen to the issue (group research paper, one partner violated academic honesty), she simply dismissed  anything we had to say. If you can take someone else for intercultural, do it!

The worst teacher ever! Has TA grade the projects based on how she feels. Gao is not clear on what she wants, she is offense. I am currently in her class now and she sucks do not take her!and she doesnt like america clearly prefers chin and will talk non stop about it

She is awful. She loves China and doesnt care who knows it. I dont give a rat about China and how you feel Americans suck. She sucks at talking and should put the mic down. If this class wasnt required I'd be outta here!

This class will require you to study, memorizing the text or cramming a few days prior to class will not work.  Class participation is a must!  I recommend you take good notes, read the book and the powerpoints.  Professor Gao is very progud of her heritage, but that's not a bad thing.  I made an A in the class.  Simply put, do the work to succeed.
She is truly a bad professor. She offends students often with and without knowledge that she has done so. Intercultural Communication should be retitled A Class About China.

Why is this woman a teacher? She was horrible! I dreaded going to class, she was off topic so many times. Her powerpoints were 20 something slides and she did them in 2 minutes, at the end of class. She was just not responsible and very lazy in responding to emails that don't relate to Asian studies. DO NOT TAKE HER! Nice lady, bad professor

This was a common sense class. If you pay attention to the power points in class and do the study guide, you will do fine. There is a group research paper. She grades it based on her preferences, not just apa style. LOTS of talk about China! She is impossible to contact via email. She will not respond in a reasonable time frame.
I took Dr. Gao for a study abroad to China. She's a tough cookie but you can tell she means well. Very intelligent. I hear she grades papers pretty strictly, but I was pleased with my grade.

I am taking her now. At the beginning of the semester I thought I would drop it because she's a stickler for reading the book. She will randomly call ppl and if you haven't read she will make you STAND for the remainder of the class. She is sweet and likes to talk abt China. Make sure you talk alot and read your book. I recommend her for sure!

If you are interested in china than this is the class for you if not do not take her for Intercultural comm. She has fav students and does not grade fair and test are very hard..I can explain this class in 3 words CHINA CHINA CHINA.

I took her for two weeks versus a whole semester due to the comments on this site. She was great- (it really was interesting) however~ her tests- impossible. it really was- definitions (easy-right?) but all multiple choice and it really could be TWO answers. So- regardless of the amount of studying- class everage was a C on midterm. Take maymester

All she talked about was china. She is quick to correct students when they're speaking even though she is not correct herself. Her test are vocab. It's nothing but a bunch of projects in her class. I wouldn't take her if you didn't have to. it's a waste of time

I will have to admit, I took Dr. Gao in '05 and I dropped her class.  I had no choice but to take her again because she was the only one teaching this course at KSU.  The work was back to back papers and she switched alot around due to time conflicts and deadlines.  Overall she is tolerable and if I got a "B" in her class anyone can.

Such a waste of time...I can honestly say  I didnt learn anything. She doesnt teach at all, just videos or power points. Her tests are so ridiculous...they are multiple choice, but several answers could work (no above all option though). She provides no guidance on papers. Will correct your grammer and word usage in papers INCORRECTLY. TAKE AUST!
WORST CLASS I EVER TOOK...COMPLETELY USELESS!!!  DIDN'T Learn a thing...except I don't like China now!!
She is genuinely concerned about the needs of her students.  She expects you to work but she will go to world's end to help you out.  If you study, you will have no problems with teacher or class.

She is very hard to follow- the classes are interesting as we all share our experiences, however the tests seem to come out of left wing, and is over nothing in class.  Best suggestion to study is the textbook, and the website for the textbook.

God, I'm taking her now and I would rather bite my arms off than to take her again. This woman is nuts!!! I took this class because I wanted to learn about various cultures, NOT JUST CHINA!!! Never again.
Stay away.  She is a sweet lady and I think she really cares about students, but her teaching methods are hard to follow and her classes are an hour and a half nap time.

Dr. Gao is very interested in what she is teaching, but due to the language barrier, she is unclear as to what exactly she wants. She loves what she does, and I know she knows what she's *trying* to say, but she just sometimes em...doesnt convey what she's

always late to class (yet marks off for student's lateness), constantly schedules things and fails to do them (i.e. peer evaluations on group projects). Very picky and unclear in what she wants from you. Has trouble understanding english language and will mark things wrong in papers that are correct. Fell asleep during class presentation.

Great instructor, gave pertinent examples. Encourages participation, speaking out in class will boost your grade. Relies on WebCT, daily lecture just a regurgitation of online notes. Major papers (2) due, interview + transcripts and a research essay. Strict APA grading.

she makes you do tons of work and usually doesnt grade it.  she is always late if you have her for a morning class but then gets mad at others when they are late.  she is hard to understand and only wants to talk about her home country.
